metadata.title: CVE-2023-37327 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
GStreamer FLAC File Parsing Integer Overflow Remote Code ExecutionVulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code on affected installations of GStreamer. Interaction withthis library is required to exploit this vulnerability but attack vectorsmay vary depending on the implementation. The specific flaw exists withinthe parsing of FLAC audio files. The issue results from the lack of propervalidation of user-supplied data, which can result in an integer overflowbefore allocating a buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability toexecute code in the context of the current process. Was ZDI-CAN-20775.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-37327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer1.0-gtk3 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-qt5 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1.1
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

gir1.2-gst-plugins-base-1.0 - 1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1
gstreamer1.0-alsa - 1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1
gstreamer1.0-gl - 1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base - 1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base-apps - 1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1
gstreamer1.0-x - 1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1
libgstreamer-gl1.0-0 - 1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1
libgstreamer-plugins-base1.0-0 - 1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good1.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-0ubuntu1.1').
gst-plugins-base1.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.1-1ubuntu0.1').
